update.description:
I ran into a funny problem while working on the [ign-cmake Components pull request](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/pull-requests/2/).

I vaguely recall during the early phase of the adoption of ign-cmake, I had accidentally moved the master header to be located in `ignition/project/project.hh` instead of `ignition/project.hh`. @caguero caught this and informed me about it, so I fixed the `install` command to install the master header back to `ignition/project.hh`.

However, it seems that the file was still getting *configured* to `include/ignition/project/project.hh` even though it's been getting installed to the correct location. It seems that at some point, `ign-msgs` was changed to accommodate this, so `ign.cc` has been using `#include "ignition/msgs/msgs.hh"`.

Here's where things get even funnier: The Components branch of `ign-cmake` was already fixed months ago to configure the master header to the correct location, even though the current `default` branch has been configuring to the wrong location. Because of this, `ign-msgs` fails to build against the Components branch of `ign-cmake`, since it can't find the file `ignition/msgs/msgs.hh` as it should actually be getting configured as `ignition/msgs.hh`.

This pull request sidesteps the issue entirely by just not using the master header. Merging this PR before we merge the [Components PR](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/pull-requests/2/) should help out the CI.

Note that none of this has any effect on end-users, because the master header has been getting *installed* to the correct location; it just hasn't been getting *configured* to the correct location inside of the build folder.
update.title: Avoid using the master include header

pull_request.title: Avoid using the master include header

pullrequest.title: Avoid using the master include header

content.raw: Note that I've also fixed `test/performance/CMakeLists.txt` and `test/regression/CMakeLists.txt`, although it didn't have an impact because those directories are empty for the time being.
content.html: Note that I've also fixed test/performance/CMakeLists.txt and test/regression/CMakeLists.txt, although it didn't have an impact because those directories are empty for the time being.

content.raw:
The integration test has been added, and its header is fixed: 47c792b

Unfortunately, I think the role of that test in the first place was to test the use of the `ignition/msgs.h` header, so modifying that might be counter-productive, but maybe we can remember to change it back after the transition is complete.
content.html:
The integration test has been added, and its header is fixed: 47c792b

Unfortunately, I think the role of that test in the first place was to test the use of the ignition/msgs.h header, so modifying that might be counter-productive, but maybe we can remember to change it back after the transition is complete.

pull_request.title: Avoid using the master include header

pullrequest.title: Avoid using the master include header

content.raw:
Good catch! My tests overlooked that because the `test/integration/CMakeLists.txt` had `ign_build_tests( ... SOURCE ... )` instead of `ign_build_tests( ... SOURCES ... )`, so that test wasn't getting configured or built.

Unfortunately, because of limitations with the cmake language, `ign_build_tests` doesn't have a very good way of identifying a typo like using `SOURCE` instead of `SOURCES`, since it can't distinguish between cases where the `SOURCES` argument is missing versus cases where `SOURCES` gets followed by an empty list.

I'll make an `ign-cmake` PR that can catch when `SOURCE` gets used instead of `SOURCES`, so that should prevent this specific problem from happening in the future.

I'll also update this PR so that the `headers.cc` test is actually getting built, and I'll adjust the `#include` in there as well.
content.html:
Good catch! My tests overlooked that because the test/integration/CMakeLists.txt had ign_build_tests( ... SOURCE ... ) instead of ign_build_tests( ... SOURCES ... ), so that test wasn't getting configured or built.

Unfortunately, because of limitations with the cmake language, ign_build_tests doesn't have a very good way of identifying a typo like using SOURCE instead of SOURCES, since it can't distinguish between cases where the SOURCES argument is missing versus cases where SOURCES gets followed by an empty list.

I'll make an ign-cmake PR that can catch when SOURCE gets used instead of SOURCES, so that should prevent this specific problem from happening in the future.

I'll also update this PR so that the headers.cc test is actually getting built, and I'll adjust the #include in there as well.

content.raw:
Do we want to remove it from the tests too just in case?

~~~
$ grep -rn "ignition/msgs/msgs" .
./test/integration/headers.cc:19:#include "ignition/msgs/msgs.hh"
~~~
content.html:
Do we want to remove it from the tests too just in case?

$ grep -rn "ignition/msgs/msgs" .
./test/integration/headers.cc:19:#include "ignition/msgs/msgs.hh"
